attributes.action: Cancel the academic year for y11 and y13- the teachers have enough information.
attributes.additional_details: The mental health of young people is important. soon suicide statistics will become higher than coronavirus. No student has motivation any more, they have gave up. Mini exams are unfair. cancel the academic year and let students rest, not only physically but mentally too. Don’t let the young generation down, they need your help. The coronavirus stress wasn’t enough, now they stress about their future too.
attributes.background: The teachers have all the information they need to give students grades. If students aren’t happy with the grade they’re given they can retake it later. Introducing mini exams has put more stress on students than ever before. They’re just bringing the real ones more forward if anything.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Cancel GCSE and A-levels in 2021 replace with Course Work and Teacher Assessment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564696

Base 2021 GCSE and A-Level Grades on Teacher Considerations and Mock Grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553307

Give students the option to take exams or receive assessed grades for 2020/21: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559964

The Department for Education and Ofqual are consulting on the approach to awarding GCSE, AS and A level grades in 2021 following the cancellation of exams. You can find out more about this consultation here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-how-gcse-as-and-a-level-grades-should-be-awarded-in-summer-2021
